thread.title: St. Joe family drives 16 hours to see Royals in Toronto
thread.title_full: St. Joe family drives 16 hours to see Royals in Toronto - KCTV5

author: Chris Oberholtz, Multimedia Producer
title: St. Joe family drives 16 hours to see Royals in Toronto
text:
ST JOSEPH, MO (KCTV) - It is about 1,000 miles or about a 16 hour drive from from Saint Joseph to Toronto.

And one family decided to make that drive on a whim to watch the Kansas City Royals in action Monday night.

"I just said jokingly we ought to go up there," Scott Ford said. "Everybody said, 'I'm in.' I said. 'I'm serious, we're not playing around. We'll get up and go right now.'"

So, at 8 p.m. Sunday, that was exactly what they did.

Ford, his dad, son, nieces and nephew-in-law drove straight through the night. Not only were they pumped up to see the Royals play, but it was also a birthday present for Ford.

They all took turns driving, but it was the birthday boy behind the wheel most of the way.

"I had to keep up with him," laughed Ford's niece, Suzie Sanders. "There was some arms coming out the window telling me to keep up. Yeah, he was excited to get here."
Unfortunately, it wasn't the outcome the family hoped for, but they say they had a blast regardless.

The crew started making the trip back from Toronto to St. Joseph as soon as the game ended. That puts the family home at approximately 2:56 p.m. Tuesday, 11 minutes before first pitch of Game 4.
